body.name: UPPAbaby Minu V2 Travel Stroller/Lightweight, Portable Design/One-Hand Fold/Shoulder Strap and Leather Bumper Bar Included/Noa (Navy/Carbon Frame/Saddle Leather)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21. Order within 20 hrs 56 mins
features: TRAVEL BIG, CARRY SMALL: At just under 17 lbs, easily bring the Minu on planes, trains, and ferries thanks to the built-in carry handle and included shoulder strap.
OVERHEAD FRIENDLY: One hand and one smooth motion are all it takes to completely fold the Minu – small enough to fit in compact travel compartments.
LARGE BASKET FOR BIGH ADVENTURES: Store everyday essentials, a diaper bag, and any souvenirs you pick up throughout your travels with the large storage basket that can hold up to 20 lbs!
EXTENDABLE UPF 50+ CANOPY: Zip-out canopy with vented peekaboo window for protection even during the sunniest vacations.
ADJUSTABLE RECLINE + LEG REST: Multi-position recline and one-handed, adjustable leg rest so your little one can nap while on-the-go.
body.description: The next generation MINU will further deliver its promise of providing essential features for everyday use in a compact lightweight design. Spacious seat suitable up to 50lbs Easy adjustment, no rethread harness Zip out extendable canopy for increased sun protection Adjustable leg rest Spring loaded fold latch Deeper basket with easy-access from back or front Leather bumper bar included Infant Car Seat and Bassinet compatible with the addition of adapters One-hand, one-step compact fold Stands when folded Carry handle or shoulder strap for hands free carry mode Multi-position recline Vented peekaboo window on canopy with UPF 50+ sun protection Shock-absorbing, all-wheel suspension 100% full-grain leather handlebar Compatible with the following select MINU accessories: Snack Tray, Basket Cover; Travel Bag, Rainshield, Car Seat Adapter (MESA), Car Seat Adapter (Other brands). *Not compatible with MINU Birth Kit or Bumper Bar accessory

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: UPPAbaby Go places, big and small. Designed for your daily adventures and exciting excursions, the MINU offers modern conveniences in a portable, lightweight stroller. Suitable from 3 months to 50 lbs From birth option sold separately: Bassinet or MESA Infant Car Seat + adapters

Features & Benefits One-handed, one-step fold One hand and one smooth motion is all it takes to fold the MINU! You can even hold baby in your other arm while folding the stroller. Smooth strolling Shock-absorbing, all-wheel suspension ensures a comfortable ride for both you and baby. Roomy seat with multi-position recline Designed to keep up with your ever-growing little one, the MINU’s spacious seat holds up to 50 lbs. Its multi-position recline and one-handed, adjustable leg rest allows your child to relax for a nap or sit upright to take in the sights. Large, easy-access basket Store everyday essentials, a diaper bag, and any extras you pick up along the way.

Take along or store away At just under 17 lbs, bring the MINU wherever life takes you thanks to the built-in carry handle and shoulder strap. Or, go hands-free with our Travel Bag backpack accessory to protect your MINU during air travel.
More from day one With convenient adapters, the UPPAbaby Bassinet or MESA Infant Car Seat can transform your MINU into an ideal resting place for your newborn.

VISTA V2 CRUZ V2 RIDGE MINU V2 G-LUXE G-LITE Age/Weight Range 3 months to 50 lbs 3 months to 50 lbs 3 months to 55 lbs 3 months to 50 lbs 3 months to 55 lbs 6 months to 55 lbs Maximum Number of Children 3 2 2 2 1 1 From Birth Options (Sold Separately) Bassinet (Included), Infant SnugSeat, MESA Infant Car Seat Bassinet, Infant SnugSeat, MESA Infant Car Seat Bassinet, MESA Infant Car Seat Bassinet, MESA Infant Car Seat Expansion (Sold Separately) RumbleSeat, PiggyBack, Bassinet/MESA (twin mode) PiggyBack PiggyBack PiggyBack True Weight (includes frame, canopy, basket, wheels) 27 lbs, Bassinet: 8.8 lbs 25.5 lbs 29.2 lbs 16.9 lbs 16.3 lbs 11.2 lbs Unfolded 36” L x 25.7” W x 39.5” H 37.5” L x 22.8” W x 40” H 38.5” L x 26” W x 40.5” H 35.5” L x 20.3” W x 41” H 28.8” L x 18.8” W x 43” H 31.3” L x 18.3” W x 42.4” H Folded 17.3" L x 25.7" W x 33.3" H 16.5" L x 22.8" W x 33" H 18.5" L x 26" W x 36.5" H 12” L x 20.3” W x 23” H 19.2” L x 12” W x 41.8” H 19.2” L x 10.7” W x 42” H Maximum Basket Capacity 30 lbs 30 lbs 20 lbs 20 lbs 10 lbs 10 lbs Reversible Seat ✓ ✓ Adjustable Handlebar ✓ ✓ ✓

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for Grandma
reviews.reviewText: Finally I found a light weight, sturdy and comfortable stroller to use with my grand child. I have arthritis in my hands and the handle of this stroller is very comfortable to use.The stroller is very stable and not tippy at all. The wheels move effortlessly over grass and trails, as well as sidewalks. They don’t have a lot of tread to collect dirt. It’s super easy to push uphill. It was easy to assemble (though I had assembled a couple before finding this one). I bought the front bar accessory and think this should be standard for safety.I wish there was an accessory to hold a snack cup.I think this stroller is worth the price due to the way it handles, the comfortable handlebar, and that it doesn’t tip easily.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for traveling
reviews.reviewText: We own the Uppababy Vista as our main stroller, but wanted something more compact and easier to travel with. The Minu stroller is easy to fold and unfold, fits well in the back of my suv with plenty of room for suitcases and other stuff. I love that this color doesn’t show the dirt as much as a black or lighter colored material, also love the leather handles, makes it look very elegant just like my Vista.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the Price
reviews.reviewText: I was on the fence about spending this much on a stroller, but I'm really glad I did. I wanted something capable of accommodating my baby who was not quiet sitting unassisted, but large enough to last through the toddler years. Something lightweight, but not flimsy. Something that didn't take up my entire trunk. Something with decent storage for bags, groceries, etc. And something with good sun protection since I live in the tropics. This checked all of those boxes. Plus, it maneuvers well and had a really smooth ride. Only complaint is the sun shade is a little floppy in moderate to strong winds.I looked for a long time, tons of online and in store research. Tried this one in a store, and nothing I found afterwards compared.The matching accessories are not great. The cupholder sticks out and is small. Not close to being large enough for my water bottle. The organizer is ok if you want to carry items, but it's not practical for drinks. Those are more issues with the accessories though as opposed to the stroller.Overall, if you're on the fence wondering if it's worth spending $450 on a stroller, I can say I'm happy I did.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great travel stroller
reviews.reviewText: Love this stroller for travel and basic use. It’s definitely not an all terrain stroller but I didn’t expect or need it to be for that purpose. We purchased a padded bag to gate check it on a flight and it held up well. When not traveling we use it at the mall, the zoo, anywhere that has a flat surface and it works great. Very smooth and great maneuverability. I really like the brake function, and the storage basket holds a large diaper bag. Very easy to fold up and doesn’t take up much space in the trunk. My very tall toddler fits in it comfortably. It is on the pricier side but for the sleek look and functionality, I find the price to be worth it. I really like how you can remove the fabric seat and canopy and use it as a stroller frame for infant car seats with adapters; I look forward to using it for this purpose with future children. All in all, it is a great stroller I would recommend to anyone for not only travel, but for daily use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great, but too big for my infant
reviews.reviewText: I really like this product. I had to return it because the shoulder straps don’t adjust and they were too high when my son was in it and it wasn’t safe or functional. The stroller is very sturdy and has good functionality. We only wheeled it around our house to test it, but it was smooth turning and riding. Once my son is bigger, I plan to purchase this stroller for traveling. It was lightweight and folded up nicely although didn’t stay together easily when folded. Ample storage space on the bottom.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best travel stroller
reviews.reviewText: I love uppababy products as they’re always quality. This stroller is no different. It’s so easy to fold, which is key if you’re actually traveling. It definitely isn’t as smooth or easy to steer as the vista or Cruz, which is to be expected. It’s much smaller, lighter, and still rides pretty well!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for my giant 2 year old
reviews.reviewText: I have a giant 22 month old (36" tall, 35lbs) and this stroller is great for on-the-go. He likes to get out and walk around when we're shopping but this stroller is lightweight and small enough that I don't mind pushing it around in case he wants to ride again. The folding mechanism is super easy and it's easy to pick up and sit in the back of your car. I drive a Palisade and I can easily put up my third row of seats and have this folded in the very back with room for groceries/bags.Size-wise it's perfect for tall toddlers and the seat is pretty cushy. He seems a lot more comfortable than he's been in our bigger stroller that has the removable seat. We're traveling soon and I'm already less anxious knowing this stroller will be so much easier to fold and leave at the jet bridge, and I won't have to take it apart at security since the seat is attached.Definitely pricey and a luxury stroller, but for us, it's worth it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this stroller!
reviews.reviewText: I LOVE this stroller. We do have the Uppababy Cruz Stroller & the Uppababy Mesa Car Seats, so are very familiar with the Uppababy brand. With that being said, we were looking for a travel stroller & I did buy the NUNA Trvl stroller as well to compare it too. Although I do like the NUNA brand, I still preferred the Minu V2 Stroller. I love the fabric of the Minu V2...it feels like athleisure clothing. I love that the basket can hold 20lbs & that you can buy lots of accessories to go w/ the stroller. I love that the stroller canopy extends longer than any other stroller & that it reclines, so my 9month old daughter can sleep if need be. The stroller is made well & doesn't feel like it's gonna break. I also love that it looks nice, has real leather accents & it’s a compact size when folded. I know it's a pricier brand, but we have not been disappointed with any of their products. I think it’s worth the splurge. 🙂
Práctica, cómoda para mi bebé y buena calidad
Exactamente como en la foto, empaque & producto en perfecto estado, inclusive llegó antes de tiempo! Super recomendable!
Ligera y funcional, buena suspensión! Pero al poco tiempo de uso ya se están deshaciendo algunas costuras
Me encanto muy practica resistente y fácil de manejar solo la tela es muy delgada y se puede romper fácilmente.
